definition: to continue in one's own way (idiom)
I/me/my
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
I/me/my
raw silk/white/plain, unadorned/vegetarian (food)/essence/nature/element/constituent/usually/always/ever

sentences.english: That spoiled brat is used to having his own way.
sentences.chinese: 那位被寵壞的小孩習慣於我行我素。

sentences.english: The grasshopper laughed at the little ant and went on his way.
sentences.chinese: 蚱蜢嘲笑着那隻小螞蟻，還是我行我素。

sentences.english: The ground is capricious like elephantine cat, the disposition of persist one's old ways.
sentences.chinese: 象貓一樣地反覆無常，我行我素的性格。

sentences.english: One by one, and to continue to do the rainbow disconsolate.
sentences.chinese: 一一和彩虹惘然至若，繼續我行我素。

sentences.english: The second reason is the old ways, the lack of a collective team spirit.
sentences.chinese: 原因之二是我行我素，缺乏一種集體的團隊精神。

sentences.english: Outsider, she alienated a low-key, lofty, persist in one's old ways.
sentences.chinese: 外人眼裏，她疏離低調，冷傲清高，我行我素。

sentences.english: They just went ahead and set off firecrackers in front of dorm buildings or ran naked.
sentences.chinese: 他們只是我行我素地在宿舍樓前放煙花，或是裸奔。

sentences.english: Smith obstinately refused to carry out the order.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯我行我素，拒不執行命令。

definition: to persist in one's views
to be one's old self (idiom)/to be unchanged/(derog.) to be stuck in one's ways
obstinately clinging to one's course (idiom)/willful/one's own way/dogmatic
obstinate/stubborn
cannot bear to see/to hate/to dislike/to disapprove
easy-going/lax/unconstrained/unruly
willful/headstrong/unruly
see 恣意妄為|恣意妄为[zi4 yi4 wang4 wei2]
recalcitrant/unreasonable/peevish
style/style of work/way
the eye can see nothing worthwhile all around (idiom); arrogant/condescending/supercilious
to consider everyone else beneath one (idiom); so arrogant that no-one else matters/condescending/to go about with one's nose in the air
rude and unreasonable
to pay no heed to (idiom)/to ignore/to brush aside
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
to take a laissez-faire attitude
